headline.main: Jamaica Making Anti-Doping Strides, Says WADA Chief
headline.print_headline: Jamaica Making Anti-Doping Strides, Says WADA Chief

docs.snippet: Jamaica has made progress toward beefing up drug-testing and repairing its tarnished sprinting reputation following a string of doping scandals, the head of the World Anti-Doping Agency told Reuters on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jamaica has made progress toward beefing up drug-testing and repairing its tarnished sprinting reputation following a string of doping scandals, the head of the World Anti-Doping Agency told Reuters on Tuesday.

headline.main: Verbatim: The First in What Could Be Many

docs.snippet: In his first rejection of major legislation, President Obama vetoed a bill to approve construction of the Keystone XL oil pipeline....
docs.abstract: In his first rejection of major legislation, President Obama vetoed a bill to approve construction of the Keystone XL oil pipeline.

headline.main: A Winter Salad Recipe from Andrew Carmellini, in Honor of Bon Appétit’s New Kitchen

headline.main: US Announces Reward for Accused Prolific Computer Hacker
headline.print_headline: US Announces Reward for Accused Prolific Computer Hacker

docs.snippet: The U.S. government has announced a $3 million reward for information leading to the arrest of a man American authorities call one of the world's most prolific computer hackers....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. government has announced a $3 million reward for information leading to the arrest of a man American authorities call one of the world's most prolific computer hackers.

headline.main: Chadian Soldiers Kill 207 Boko Haram Fighters in Nigeria-Army
headline.print_headline: Chadian Soldiers Kill 207 Boko Haram Fighters in Nigeria-Army

docs.snippet: Soldiers from Chad killed 207 Boko Haram militants in fighting on Tuesday near a Nigerian town close to the border with Cameroon, Chad's army announced in a statement....
docs.lead_paragraph: Soldiers from Chad killed 207 Boko Haram militants in fighting on Tuesday near a Nigerian town close to the border with Cameroon, Chad's army announced in a statement.

headline.main: Britain Becomes First Nation to Legalize Three-Parent Babies
headline.print_headline: Britain Becomes First Nation to Legalize Three-Parent Babies

docs.snippet: - Britain will become the first nation to legalize a "three-parent" IVF technique which doctors say can prevent some inherited incurable diseases but which critics fear will effectively lead to "designer babies"....
docs.lead_paragraph: - Britain will become the first nation to legalize a "three-parent" IVF technique which doctors say can prevent some inherited incurable diseases but which critics fear will effectively lead to "designer babies".

headline.main: Persistence Pays Off in Reporting on Jihadi

docs.snippet: The struggles of a Times video journalist, Mona El-Naggar, to find and interview the family and friends of an Egyptian man who joined the Islamic State in Syria....

headline.main: Oscars demuestran la creciente distancia entre el público y la Academia
headline.print_headline: Moviegoers and Academy Move Further Apart

docs.snippet: La trasmisión sufrió una pérdida de ratings que refleja que la Academia no tiene conexión con las películas que millones de personas pagan por ver....
docs.lead_paragraph: La trasmisión sufrió una pérdida de ratings que refleja que la Academia no tiene conexión con las películas que millones de personas pagan por ver.

headline.main: Scientists Name New Species of Wasp After Boston Bruins Goalie Rask
headline.print_headline: Scientists Name New Species of Wasp After Boston Bruins Goalie Rask

docs.snippet: A team of researchers studying insects in Africa has named a newly discovered species of wasp with a distinctive yellow-and-black pattern after Boston Bruins goalie Tuukka Rask, the Boston Globe reported on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A team of researchers studying insects in Africa has named a newly discovered species of wasp with a distinctive yellow-and-black pattern after Boston Bruins goalie Tuukka Rask, the Boston Globe reported on Tuesday.
